body_html:
Hey @F3PiX and @klappradla !

As stated via Slack, I am not a huge fan of PR templates.

Even with <!-- comments like this ---> I foresee a lot of placeholder clutter remaining in the PR.

I don't think we need to make the preflight checklist a checkable GHFMD list. It should be a reminder for the person lodging the PR, not being checked after the PR is created. We don't need an extra checklist to see if there are tests - we can have a look at the diff.

I wouldn't encourage new people to use the keywords closes and fixes as this will introduce a post-hook. It is perfectly fine for ongoing contributors who know their way around the app.

My idea of a PR template would look a bit like this:

(Describe what this PR is about - what feature does it add, which bug does it fix? Link related issues. Tests are much appreciated. Add screenshots/gifs if your PR includes visual changes)

Quite spartan, I know
